compilations.description: The Keto diet is a popular low-carb, high-fat plan that can allow your body to burn fat for energy. Navigating a new diet and all its rules is always tricky, but we’re here to help! From a super filling and satisfying beef and veggie stir-fry to quick and easy baked avocado eggs, these Ketogenic diet recipes will show you how to satisfy your cravings in a completely Keto-friendly way.
compilations.name: 6 Keto-Friendly Meals
5 Low-Carb Breakfasts
compilations.description: If you’re watching your carb intake, breakfast can be a tricky meal. Thankfully, we have easy and delicious low-carb breakfast ideas for you! You can prep some ahead, like these sausage and egg cups, for a grab-and-go option. But if you have 20 extra minutes in the morning and want to treat yourself, try these baked avocado eggs. They’re super easy and you can have fun with the toppings and try whatever you have on hand in your kitchen.

Switch up your basic egg breakfasts (or dinners, who are we to judge?) and try out some of these unique recipes that champion the simple, protein-packed food. The Hong-Kong style egg tarts are a delight to the palate and are a great new way to challenge yourself in the kitchen. If you're looking for an exciting new replacement for your run-of-the-mill omelet, give this tortilla de patata a try!
compilations.name: New And Unique Ways To Cook Eggs
Recipes For Avo Cardio Lovers!
compilations.description: We've curated some 'avo-rable' recipes for all green goddesses out there because, well, avocados never go out of style! Kick off your morning with a hearty and healthy Cheddar & Chive Avocado Egg. If you want to spruce things up, test out a nutrient-packed Avocado Quinoa Power Salad. We've got just the right recipes to celebrate everyone's favorite green superfood (don't worry, we won't tell kale if you won't).

You know those people who can't cook but love to eat? Are you one of those people? Well then, we're here to save your day with these easy recipes that are anything but boring. Test out our scrumptious Sweet Potato Chips.Then, follow them up with a fun and flavorful plate of Spaghetti with Garlic & Oil. Try out these foolproof recipes and tell all your friends – get ready to impress them with your surprise cooking skills! Believe me, they're going to be floored.
compilations.name: Easy Recipes Anyone Can Make!

compilations.description: You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!
compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes

results.keywords: avocado, bacon, bake, basil, breakfast, buzzfeed, cheddar, cheese, chive, eggs, fresh, goodful, healthy, tomato, vegetarian

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Slice the avocados in half and remove the pits.
Place the avocado halves on a baking sheet and scoop out some of the flesh to make a bigger hole.
Crack one egg into each hole and season with salt and pepper.
Top with toppings of choice and bake for 15 minutes or until yolk reaches desired consistency.
Sprinkle with fresh herbs, as desired.
Enjoy!

results.name: Baked Avocado Eggs

compilations.name: 7 Days 7 Toast Recipes
compilations.description: We love bread — who doesn't? Toasts are our true loves, but we've gotta keep it interesting. Luckily, we've curated seven days worth of toasts to satisfy the toast-lover in you. Our sheet pan shakshuka toast simplifies a flavorful classic while our flavorful, Nutella-marshmallow toast gives you the sugar jolt you need to get your day going. Out of bread? The Bacon and Eggs Sweet Potato Toast is here to come to the rescue. Here's a toast to better mornings!

compilations.name: Make Room For These Mushroom Recipes
compilations.description: The shroomster's in town: the 'mush'roomster, that is! Mushrooms are a beautiful, beautiful thing but sometimes, you just don't know what to do with 'em! That's why we're here: from a mouthwatering cheese-stuffed mushroom burger to an elaborate, Instagram-ready bacon mushroom skewer, these shroomerific delights will, well, blow your mind. Fire up the pan, because these mushrooms stop for no one!

Anytime is snacktime, and we're here to keep you munching for every day of the month. Start small with a heaping bowl of Rainbow Kettle Corn. Once you master the art of snacking, move on to some Grilled Fajita Skewers! The best part - you won't be the only 'snack' in your house, if you get our drift.
compilations.name: 30 Snacks For 30 Days

components.raw_text: 1 teaspoon McCormick Paprika, plus extra for garnish

instructions.display_text: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and McCormick Paprika and let sizzle for a minute. Stir in the mushrooms and salt, adding in a little more oil if the pan looks dry. Saute until mushrooms are browned, about 10 minutes.
Pour in heavy cream and scallions (reserve a couple scallions for garnishing). Stir to combine, then remove from the heat and set aside.
Brush both sides of the pieces of bread with olive oil. Toast bread in a skillet over low heat until golden brown on both sides.
Pile mushrooms onto the toast. Top each with a poached egg. Lightly dust each egg with a bit of McCormick Paprika and garnish with a couple of scallions.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: 5 Low-Carb Meal Recipes To Start Off Your Year Right
5 Healthy Breakfast Recipes To Keep You Fresh All Day
Omelette Recipes Perfect For Your Weekend Breakfast
Healthy Breakfast Recipes To Start Your Morning

compilations.description: You promised yourself that you'll take care of your health — and we've got you covered! Start your morning with a refreshing Banana Berry Smoothie Bowl, or chow down on some Vegetarian Breakfast Apple Sausages. You can also indulge with some Vegan French Toast. We can't think of a better way to start the day.
compilations.name: Healthy Breakfast Recipes For 2021
Low Carb Meals For A Week
compilations.description: If you're looking to eat low carb this week, you're in the right place. We've got recipes that cut the carbs without sacrificing flavor at all. On Mondays, when you just don't have the energy to do anything, test out our energy-boosting Low Carb Egg White Omelet. Feeling a little more indulgent? Give our Low Carb Eggplant Lasagna a shot! Whatever you pick, you can't go wrong.

instructions.display_text: Place the lime juice, water, avocado, Greek yogurt, salt, and pepper in a blender and blend until smooth. Set aside.
Add oil to a pan over medium heat.
Add onions and peppers and cook until nearly soft, about 5 minutes.
Add spinach and cheese and stir for another 2 to 3 minutes. Set aside.
Add oil to a pan over medium heat.
Add the egg whites to the pan and season with salt and pepper. Cook until set, about 2 minutes.
Flip the eggs and let set for about 1 minute.
Fill the egg whites with the pepper, onion, spinach, and cheese mixture. Roll up the egg white omelette.
Top with avocado dressing, tomato, and cilantro.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: Super Quick Breakfasts That Every Millennial Should Know
compilations.description: Who doesn't like a quick and easy breakfast that will instantly fill you up? From some versatile banana pancakes to cheesy egg toast, these recipes will keep you satisfied for rest of the day. Open up our treasure trove of recipes and never step out of the house hungry again.

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
On a cutting board, split the bell peppers in half from stem to base. Cut out the stem and the seeds.
Transfer halved peppers to a baking tray, cavity side up. Sprinkle each half with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until peppers are slightly soft.
Sprinkle the mozzarella and half of the chives evenly among the four pepper halves. Then crack eggs into the center of each pepper.
Sprinkle the salt, pepper, bacon, cheddar, and remaining chives on top of the eggs.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until egg whites are set. Serve!
Enjoy!
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Push 3 tater tots in each cup of a non-stick muffin tin.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 10 minutes. Remove from oven.
Place your favorite omelette fillings in each muffin tin on top of the tater tots.
Pour egg mixture into each muffin tin.
Bake at 350°F (177°C) for 20 minutes, or until fully cooked!
Enjoy!
